stenR 0.2.0003

    • Procedural and Object-oriented workflows of stenR

    R6 class containing computed freqtable

    Comp_Freqtable.Rd

    Computed frequency table class. On basis of raw scores of some variables, it creates a frequency table and allows to compute scores in some standard scale. To initialize the object of this class the 'gen_freqtable' function is recommended.

    Methods

    Public methods

    • Comp_Freqtable$get_status()

    • Comp_Freqtable$get_data_info()

    • Comp_Freqtable$new()

    • Comp_Freqtable$get_freqtables()

    • Comp_Freqtable$attach_scale()

    • Comp_Freqtable$compute_scores()

    • Comp_Freqtable$get_scoretables()

    • Comp_Freqtable$get_computed_scores()

    • Comp_Freqtable$get_computed_scores_ext()

    • Comp_Freqtable$clone()

    Method get_status()

    Current information about object

    Usage

    Comp_Freqtable$get_status()

    Returns

    List of metrics

    • n: Number of observations for frequency table generation

    • kept_data: Is the data kept in the object?

    • frequency_tables: Are the frequency table complete or incomplete?

    • standardized_scores: Are the standardized scores computed - and if yes, then: for which scales?

    Method get_data_info()

    Information about kept data

    Usage

    Comp_Freqtable$get_data_info()

    Method new()

    Initialization of the 'comp_freqtable' class

    Usage

    Comp_Freqtable$new(data, vars, id, keep_data = T)

    Arguments

    data

    data to use for computing.

    vars

    character vector containing column names of numeric variables that you want to calculate frequency tables for.

    id

    character string containing column name for identification of the observations. Needed only if 'keep_data' is TRUE

    keep_data

    do you want to keep the table for getting scores for individual observations? Defaults to TRUE.

    Method get_freqtables()

    Get generated frequency tables.

    Usage

    Comp_Freqtable$get_freqtables()

    Returns

    Two lists, containing actual cumulated frequency tables and their statuses

    • freqtables: Cumulated frequency tables for each variable specified during initialization

    • statuses: Statuses for each frequency table. 'complete' if there was at least one observation for each raw score between actual minimum and maximum. 'incomplete' if there was at least one missing raw score and they were filled automatically

    Method attach_scale()

    Attach new scale to the object

    Usage

    Comp_Freqtable$attach_scale(scale)

    Arguments

    scale

    FreqtableScale object defining a scale

    Method compute_scores()

    Compute scores in scale of your choice. After computation, you can get them with 'get_scoretables' method.

    Usage

    Comp_Freqtable$compute_scores(scale)

    Arguments

    scale

    Either a character string indicating one of built-in scale, or FreqtableScale object describing new scale. If new scale is declared, it will be automatically attached

    Method get_scoretables()

    Get computed scoring tables for all variables

    Usage

    Comp_Freqtable$get_scoretables(scale)

    Arguments

    scale

    character string indicating for which computed scale return values

    Returns

    List containing the actual tables with raw score and standardized score pairs

    Method get_computed_scores()

    Get computed scores for specified ids or all sourced observations. You can only use this method if you chose to keep source data.

    Usage

    Comp_Freqtable$get_computed_scores(scale, vars = NULL, ids = NULL)

    Arguments

    scale

    character string defining the computed scale. Mandatory argument.

    vars

    character vector declaring for which variables of the embedded data to get the standardized score. If not specified, returns values for all

    ids

    for the observations in kept data. If none is provided, then it is returned for all observations.

    Method get_computed_scores_ext()

    Get computed scores for external observations

    Usage

    Comp_Freqtable$get_computed_scores_ext(data, scale, vars, attach = TRUE)

    Arguments

    data

    data.frame containing raw scores to get standardized scores for

    scale

    character string defining the computed scale

    vars

    character vector declaring variables for which to get standardized score. If the variables in external data are named differently, the vector should be named accordingly.

    attach

    boolean indicating if new data should be attached to the frequency table. Defaults to TRUE.

    Method clone()

    The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

    Usage

    Comp_Freqtable$clone(deep = FALSE)

    Arguments

    deep

    Whether to make a deep clone.
